threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered miner. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects a suspicious ELF binary with UPX compression
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Execution Of Script Located In Potentially Suspicious Directory
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects executions of scripts located in potentially suspicious locations such as "/tmp" via a shell such as "bash", "sh", etc.

Detects usage of the 'crontab' utility to remove the current crontab.
This is a common occurrence where cryptocurrency miners compete against each other by removing traces of other miners to hijack the maximum amount of resources possible
Detects creation of cron file or files in Cron directories which could indicates potential persistence.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Roberto Rodriguez (Cyb3rWard0g), OTR (Open Threat Research), MSTIC

attributes.magic: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, Intel 80386, version 1 (GNU/Linux), statically linked, no section header

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE ABUSE.CH SSL Blacklist Malicious SSL certificate detected

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET POLICY Signed TLS Certificate with md5WithRSAEncryption"; flow:established,from_server; content:"|16 03 01|"; depth:3; content:"|02|"; distance:2; within:1; byte_jump:3,0,relative,big; content:"|16 03 01|"; within:3; content:"|0b|"; distance:2; within:2; content:"|30 82|"; distance:9; within:2; content:"|30 82|"; distance:2; within:2; content:"|a0 03 02 01 02 02|"; distance:2; within:6; byte_jump:1,0,relative,big; content:"|30 0d 06 09 2a 86 48 86 f7 0d 01 01 04 05 00|"; within:15; reference:url,www.win.tue.nl/hashclash/rogue-ca/; reference:url,ietf.org/rfc/rfc3280.txt; reference:url,jensign.com/JavaScience/GetTBSCert/index.html; reference:url,luca.ntop.org/Teaching/Appunti/asn1.html; reference:url,news.netcraft.com/archives/2012/08/31/governments-and-banks-still-using-weak-md5-signed-ssl-certificates.html; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2015686; rev:3; metadata:created_at 2012_09_07, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2019_07_26;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET HUNTING Generic IOT Downloader Malware in POST (Outbound)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET HUNTING Generic IOT Downloader Malware in POST (Outbound)"; flow:established,to_server; http.method; content:"POST"; http.request_body; content:"wget"; content:".sh|3b 20|chmod +x|20|"; within:200; fast_pattern; content:"|3b 20|./"; within:100; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2029009; rev:3; metadata:affected_product Linux, attack_target IoT, created_at 2019_11_20, deployment Perimeter, confidence Medium, signature_severity Major, tag Description_Generated_By_Proofpoint_Nexus, updated_at 2020_11_04;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: APP-DETECT VNC server response
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"APP-DETECT VNC server response"; flow:established; content:"RFB 0",depth 5; content:".0",depth 2,offset 7; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:560; rev:9; )

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: The binary is a packed executable, identified by strings like "UPX-5.0" and a URL referencing the UPX packer project (`upx[.]sf[.]net`). This is a common technique to obfuscate malicious code. Its behavior is highly suspicious, employing modern evasion techniques. It uses the `memfd_create` syscall to create an anonymous file in memory, into which it unpacks its payload for fileless execution. As a fallback, it may use a temporary file in `/dev/shm`. The use of direct syscalls instead of library imports is a strong indicator of malware attempting to evade detection.
